  • City: BARRINGTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. IT WAS NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET. PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED, REPACKED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: 1 CONTAINER HAD A TEAR IN THE INNER SEAL AND APPROXIMATELY A HALF CUP OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED, REPACKED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024021169
item.description:
Report X-2024021169

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE (1) OF FOUR (4) BOTTLE OF DIVERSY PRESOAK WAS FOUND ELEAKING. THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE DIVERSY PRESOAK CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024021134
item.description:
Report X-2024021134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents arrived at hazmat area in fiberboard box inside another plastic container with signs of internal and external damages. The contents were inspected, and one was missing with signs of leakage from two (2) of the three (3) that remain. It was evident that leakage was due to loosen caps. The caps were tightened, and contents were placed in a lined salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The failure of the package was due to loosen caps on of its contents. An estimated amount of 1/4 of two (2) of the remaining three (3) bottles were leaked out. There were no signs of punctures on the bottles. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The loose caps that were found on inspection were tightened, and contents were placed in a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021488
item.description:
Report X-2024021488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021488 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO TWO SALVAGE DRUMS. ONE YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE THREE GOOD BOTTLES AND ONE SMALL WHITE SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE ONE BAD BOTTLE THAT LEAKED. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT DUE TO A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP AND APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT FROM THE BOTTLE HAVING THAT LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY HAVING ME COME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. 2. X-2024021493 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MAMAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THE BOTTOM CLOSURE WAS COMING OFF A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. THE TWO BROKEN AND LEAKING BOTTLES WERE PACKED SEPERATELY FROM THE TWO GOOD BOTTLES. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS LEAKED OUT DUE TO LOOSE CAPS FROM TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. WAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING ONE CUP TO LEAK OUT OF EACH OF THOSE TWO BOTTLES MAKING A TOTAL OF 2 CUPS OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT FROM THE LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2024020959
item.description:
Report X-2024020959

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020959 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at the Hazmat cage during the Day Sort with signs of external damage due to internal leakage. Upon inspection of the package and its contents one of the four bottles was found without a cap. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a missing cap. Approximately 1/16 of the contents was leaked out of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected and placed into a lined salvage drum to prevent any further leakage or damages. 2. X-2024020963 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE (PARTB) OF RAPICIDE WAS FOUND 1/2 WAY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020973
item.description:
Report X-2024020973

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I THEN REPACKED IT IN A SMALL WHITE SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. DescribePack: APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP LEAKED FROM TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. A TOTAL OF 1 CUP OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN HAVING ME REPACK IT INTO A WHITE SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2024020950
item.description:
Report X-2024020950

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND ALSO THAT THE CLOSURES WERE TORN OPEN. THEY IMMEDICATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN NOTIFIED TO COME AND REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. DescribePack: APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF RAPICIDE PART B LEAKED OUT OF ONE BOTTLE DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. THE OTHER 3 BOTTLES DID NOT HAVE ANY LEAKAGE. THEY JUST HAD THE LIQUID ALL OVER THEM FROM THE LEAKAGE THAT HAPPENED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

Report X-2024020815

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED ONE EVERSTART MAXX-59 BATTERY LEAKING AND WAS NOT PACKAGED CORRECTLY. DescribePack: THE BATTERY APPEARED TO BE LEAKING AND WAS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING RETURNED TO WALMART. THE BATTERY SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN PICKED BY DRIVER WHEN IT WAS NOT PACKAGED CORRECTLY AND THEREFORE CAUSING THE PACKAGE LEAK. THE PACKAGE IS BOTH UNDECLARED AND UNPROCESSED. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020763
item.description:
Report X-2024020763

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON UNLOADING PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED A WET BOX. NOTIFIED THE MANAGER. HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND HAZMAT TOTE WHERE IT WAS THEN TAKEN DOWN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, WHERE IT WAS PROCESSED. DescribePack: THE BOX WAS WET WITH SOME INTERNAL LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE LID ON ONE OF THE PAILS INSIDE THE BOX WAS SLIGHTLY ASKEW AND SOME OF THE LIQUID FOR THE WIPES LEAKED OUT ONTO THE PAPER PACKING AND THE OUTER FIBREBOARD BOX.
